result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defense requests time for defendant to complete counseling.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

State advises there is a global offer in the file and will send the offer to the Defense.

09:13 AM Defendant Marcelino Robles in court with attorney Joseph James Dorlack.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is waiting for discovery on the new matter.
Defense requests to address bail.  State is not prepared to address bail today. 
Court will schedule a further proceedings date as well as a bail/bond hearing.
Defense to file the written bail motion by the end of the business day on 4/12/22 or the bail hearing will be canceled.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
